intro: Priestleya myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtleleaf priestleya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and emit a mild, pleasant scent when crushed. Priestleya myrtifolia produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
